website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced, push lawn sweeper that is best for picking up leaves and grass clippings on a smaller yard.
pros: This 21-inch lawn sweeper features no-tool assembly and a dial-in height adjuster that is located on the front of the unit for effortless access
The hopper is an easy to remove collection bag and the entire unit can fold for storage
cons: This lawn sweeper is not intended for heavy duty use and may function with limited effectiveness on uneven surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Quicker-leafer-upper
customer_reviews.text: I just received my item on 11/9 & assembled & used it today 11/11/18. I absolutely LOVE ❤️❤️❤️ this item. Assembly is not difficult at all. If all instructions for the assembly are followed exactly as indicated, it works like a charm. I recommend this item. My “yard time” was reduced by almost half.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions!
customer_reviews.text: After having bought ans used this sweeper... im lead to believe that all the negative reviews are from people who didnt read the instructions and adjust the sweeper to their grass. When properly adjusted(brushes .25 inches into grass) it works as intended. If you just put it together and go straight to using it.. it will not work properly. In short: adjust the brushes before using.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Considering the high amount of 1 star ratings, I felt I had to write my experience with this as a contrast. This product is easy to assemble and very lightweight. The only challenge is finding the right adjustment level for this to work well, that depends on your the ground you are going to be working with. In my case, my frontyard... half of it is flat and the other not so much. It worked great in both conditions and I was able to pick up most leaves within minutes, much better than using a rake, especially for my back. It's quiet too...won't bother the neighbors!
customer_reviews.author: Kenyi A.

customer_reviews.title: I'm not head over heels in love, but I'll use it because it helps to ...
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it's not worth the price. It picks up leaves and twigs, but it doesn't clear up the lawn completely. It holds half a wheelbarrow worth of leaves. It's more effective to use a rake for thick leaf areas. I could see this working during the early fall when leaves are first starting to come down. You'd have to go put everyday for 15 minutes for it to be fully effective. I'm not head over heels in love, but I'll use it because it helps to ease strain on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Garbo

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean up sweet gum balls. I have a monster of a tree that litters the entire neighborhood with the things. I takes a couple of passes at the lowest setting (freshly cut lawn) to pick up the little headaches.The trick seems to be pushing it swiftly and intently. Better than raking them but still a pain. It picks up lawn clippings like a pro but the bag fills up quickly. It does not seem as if it was built to last but it gets the job done for the most part. Not sure how long it will hold up with heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: SLI

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work!  It does not  sweep leaves as it advertises.
customer_reviews.text: The Earthwise sweep LSW70021 does not sweep or pick up leaves as the product description indicates! We have adjusted it, we have used it on various surfaces. It does not work! It tosses the leaves around and makes more work picking them up! Do not purchase this product. I am surprised and disappointed that Amazon sells a product that is so inferior. I will more carefully choose which products I purchase from Amazon in the future, now knowing that they sell anything even if it does not do what it claims to do, so simple, pick up leaves. I only chose one star because there was not a lower rating.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula  A. Gallichotte

customer_reviews.title: Works great for PINE NEEDLES!
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT for pine needles, pine cones, leaves & small twigs! It works best if there’s not too little or too much pine needles on the ground. If there’s a lot, you have to go over it a few times because it will clump up in front of the sweeper. But that makes it easy to just pick up. This was the FIRST time we have “raked” our yard. Our neighbors came out while I was “sweeping” the needles and IMMEDIATELY ordered one. Also...delivery date was October 20-22. I got it October 17!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth O

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work :-(
customer_reviews.text: I just spent 2 hours assembling and trying to get this to work. Assembly was easy. I adjusted the height many times trying to get it to work. The problem is the wheels don't turn because they are cheap plastic with no traction, the brush assembly needs to be bigger and the catcher is so small if you do get it to work a little, you have to dump it too often and it's awkward. I will be asking for a return shipping label. I So wanted this item to work. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Fair initial value
customer_reviews.text: This will certainly do the job, and seems to be worth the money. It would be better if it came with rear wheels, rather that just plastic feet that would wear away on abrasive surfaces. For $9, I put a rear axle with 7.5" wheels. I like the plastic brushes, as they should outlast the old fashioned kind. We'll see how long the plastic wheels last.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah F

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The tree in my front yard is constantly dropping leaves, this time of year. Every week I am filling 7 paper lawn and refuse bags. It takes me approx 4 hours to sweep and rake up the leaves. I saw this and thought it was a godsend. It wasn't. 5 passes over the same area and it didnt even get a 1/4 of the leaves. DO NOT waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Bill P

customer_reviews.title: Yes it does pine needles.
customer_reviews.text: Read some of the reviews about it not doing pine needles. It does and does it well. Takes a couple passes, but if you have it set at the correct level it works great.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Set up in 20 minutes, great for grass clippings!
customer_reviews.text: Liked: Super fast setup. Came with most of the hardware minus 1 bolt and nut. No tools were needed really. -picks up grass clippings like a champ -it’s adjustable in sweeping height to accommodate your grass cut Didn’t like: -first one came in with broken wheels -missing some hardware during install -wheels are kind of candy @ss. Needs rubber tires
customer_reviews.author: Justin Brown

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed by this product! For my needs it worked perfectly. It went over several types of surfaces and made quick work of picking up the leaves. And was SOO much easier then a rake and manually gathering leaves. The sweeper did a terrific job of getting leaves and other debris into catcher and had no issues clogging like some reviews claim. Catcher is also a good design for getting leaves in bag or receptacle, but a funnel is useful. Can't say enough how happy I am with this purchase! I have never had so much fun picking up leaves. Assembly was very easy. Well worth the investment and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: This is so easy to use and at 75 I clean the extra ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use and at 75 I clean the extra grass so I don't have to vacuum inside after mowing. Love this.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Mostly works
customer_reviews.text: This sweeper is really only effective if your grass, or whatever you're sweeping, is pretty much the same height. The is an adjustment for height on the front but while you're sweeping if you hit some slightly taller grass, the sweeper will just get stuck. If you run across areas where the grass is just a little shorter, then the sweeper won't pick anything up so it is a bit fickly about height.
customer_reviews.author: Josmarcas

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend for light duty use
customer_reviews.text: Lots of plastic parts. I would recommend for light duty use. Great for what I need it for which is periodic clean up after all the heavy dose of leaves have been removed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I suspect maybe it was our type of leaves given the other good reviews on here, but it really didn't work for us. We changed the depth across all options and still didn't have good success. It basically just pushed the debris forward and the 20% or so that it did catch it throws up and just hopes that it gets caught in the bag. I had high hopes, but our leaf blower/vacuum works much better and therefore we returned this product. The return went very well!
customer_reviews.author: Blair Henderson

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: This was broke when it arrived. Looks like someone cut stickers of box. Does not pick anything up. I had to modify it to make it work at all. Box was so beat up It is not possible to repack it and send it back. This was obviously a used product that was repackaged. This should be list as used. Very very upset
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The Earth wise sweep it is exactly as advertised. Using the height adjustment knob in the front it will navigate long or short grass relatively easy. For those of us old enough to remember the old push mowers with the spinning blades, this piece of equipment is very comparable in ease-of-use and mobility over your lawn. The biggest downside I have found is the basket only gets 95% full without manually making room. This is not a brush hog 5000 and works better over short grass. It has a small to medium basket size and will NOT do your 100 acres in only two trips.
customer_reviews.author: Paul  Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to pick up the maple tree leaves in my front yard. First, it did not pick up all the leaves even though I adjusted it several times. When it did pick up the leaves they did not go in the Collection Bag, there was a build-up at the interface between the sweeper and the bag. I finally went back to my rake to gather the leaves.
customer_reviews.author: JESSE R TEAL JR

customer_reviews.title: So happy I order this works great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, works great I can’t believe how great it works I’m so happy at what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Better then raking
customer_reviews.text: Was unsure if I should purchase because of all the mixed reviews, but I am glad i did. Sure beats raking or holding a heavy leaf blower. You do have to go over the same area two times if your leaves are piled up, but it does pick them up. Basket fills up quickly so emptying it out often is a must, but very easy to do so. Some leaves do jump back out but you can always make a cover as one reviewer suggested (I didn't) I believe it's worth the money even tho not perfect
customer_reviews.author: momsboys5

customer_reviews.title: Not for tall people
customer_reviews.text: The handle is too low and I have to bend over to push it...not good for tall people (over 5'8") My back gets more tired pushing this than raking. Also the basket does not hold many leaves. Also works best if there is only a small amount of leaves to go over, otherwise you have to go over the same spot multiple times. My young son likes to push it around though and "help" with the leaves. Pretty expensive for use a a "toy" though.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but all plastic
customer_reviews.text: This sweeper is great for picking up fluffy leaves and debris in your yard, but won't really work on anything compacted. It worked great for my pine needles and under a few trees in my yard. Pros- -Lightweight and easy to maneuver -Easy to put together -Easier than raking and picks up light weight lawn debris easily (leaves, needles, seeds, etc) Cons- -All plastic, kinda feels like a Fischer Price lawn tool -The basket fills up really fast -The basket doesn't really clip on to the sweeper, so it can flop off easily
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay B

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Gets jammed in twigs and the like but works well and beats trying to rake up leaves by hand to put in the can. I have artificial turf and travelled areas. Beats the weight and dust of a leaf blower. This is much more enjoyable to use. Assembly directions not good but easy enuf to figure out. Seems overpriced for what it is but I am glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Stp

customer_reviews.title: Pine needle grabber!
customer_reviews.text: I messed up a rotator cuff in a vehicle accident a few years back, the motion of raking is tough for long periods, but pushing a mower or this is no problem. Won't grab crabapples, they're too heavy and flip right back to the ground, but leaves and needles will quickly fill the bin. It's easy and fast to remove and attach!
customer_reviews.author: April KellyWright

customer_reviews.title: Light weight sweeper with easy depth change
customer_reviews.text: I have owned push lawn sweepers before. They were heavy, so I have usually left them with the house. This is a very light lawn sweeper and therefore, once assembled, easy to use. The main negative is the assembly manual. It uses familiar words in a way that an English speaking person does not readily understand. For example, "Secure the bottom hook by clicking the buckle into the hole positioned on the housing as pointed by the arrow." There is no hook. There is no buckle. There is no housing. There is no arrow. Basically, you are on your own. However, once assembled, this lawn sweeper does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Delay

customer_reviews.title: Works So-So
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our fenced in backyard because we can't get our riding mower (with leaf collection) back there. It's easy to assemble. My 4 and 6 year olds can push it. However, it takes several passes to collect all the leaves. The faster you push it, the better it picks up. I will continue to use it, as it helps with getting my steps in for the day. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Teach2relax

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed? I bought this so i can pick up my grass clippings so i can make them in to bales after it dries out. This picked it up wonderfully......... I am so glad i seen this one. It is well worth the money and it's gonna save me so much money. I have already done 2 bales and those are 8.50 a piece. By summers end it will have paid for itself 2 x over.
customer_reviews.author: Berri peterson

customer_reviews.title: Yard Sweeper
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase, I put together and had to take apart at the end for the hoper as I put the parts on backwards. My husband had to help with the 1/4 inch from the yard because I couldn’t figure out how to adjust and there are no instructions for how to raise/lower. Once that is done, the knob tightens to keep in place. Fills up fast with lots of leaves but easy to empty. We have lots of leaves so this will be helpful, been using for a few weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Good for light duty, no substitute for hand-raking.
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived crushed on one end with a hole in it, but nothing was damaged. It works pretty well for a light accumulation of leaves or other debris, like a single overnight's-worth of fallen leaves or cleaning up leftover larger fragments after going over with a lawnmower power rake blade. For ordinary accumulation, raking by hand or using the mower and then picking up larger leftovers with this is probably optimal. Trying to use this as a full rake-replacement would mean going over the same area several times and having to stop to empty every 2-3 square meters or so.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because I hate raking leaves. I put it together, very easy . The directions should have been a little clearer and not so dark. I waited to test the item , once the leaves started falling . Yesterday I had an opportunity to use this item and I was pleasantly surprised. It worked well and was very easy to use . I would recommend it to all my friends and family. I give it 5 stars ⭐️.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I finally purchased this product after endless yard raking of just under an acre. Such a great purchase! It picks up grass clippings and other yard/tree debris with ease. Light weight, easy to assemble. Our neighbor even asked what we started doing different in the front yard because it looked so good.
customer_reviews.author: Bfresh2032

customer_reviews.title: almost worthless
customer_reviews.text: if you only have leaves then this works. Doesn't really pickup anything else. I have pine needles and these mini pinecones (see photo). It picks up less than 10% with each pass. I have astro turf lawn and a putting green. doesn't work well on either. It seems to only pickup leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Kim N.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would pick up pine needles from my lawn. Before I ordered it, I asked the Amazon community if it would pick up pine needles on a lawn. The answers I got said it would. It picked up hardly any, despite repeated passes over the lawn and changing the height.
customer_reviews.author: clmpdx

customer_reviews.title: Used for Turf
customer_reviews.text: I love this lawn sweeper! My entire backyard is astro turf and there is a large mesquite tree that covers the grass. Great for shade, terrible for all the little leaves it leaves behind. I've tried leaf blowers, rakes, nothing works great. It either isn't power enough or takes way to much work. With this device I can push it across the grass and it picks up all the little stems and leaves after just 1 or 2 passes.
customer_reviews.author: Illyssa T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Artificial Turf
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product not so much for the leaves from my Ficus Nitida (Indian Laurel) but for the little pea-size figs that drop from the tree during certain times of the year (see pictures). I have an approximate 15' x 50' area of artificial turf that constantly needs raking because of the ficus tree. This product pushes the ficus size leaves around as much as picks them up but it does a pretty good job of picking up the majority of the figs that get caught in between the grass fibers! It may do much better on different surfaces and with different size leaves. I also use it to "spruce up" the artificial grass when having company over.
customer_reviews.author: longplay55

customer_reviews.title: I sent it back
customer_reviews.text: We just got this in a couple days ago, and could not use it. One of the Support bars for the bad was missing. in a way I am kind of glad this was the case. it seems cheaply made, and very flimsy. The only solid piece on this is the handle bar. It truly feels like it would break after one really good use. I would not waste the money, like some have said. the quality is lacking, and if your lucky like me it will come with missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Cmerkey

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job picking up leaves and debris
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on artificial turf. Does a great job picking up leaves and debris. Works great on sidewalks and driveways. It takes some adjustments to set the correct height for the surface you are sweeping.
customer_reviews.author: Westie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on lawn but does well on the sidewalks
customer_reviews.text: Does not work in Ohio. If you have a big yard that's not flat this will not work. It works on the sidewalk and removes the leaves but on my lawn not so much. I spent less time actually raking than trying to use this machine and I changed the setting many times trying to find the perfect height. Don't buy this expecting to do fall leaf cleanup on actually lawn unless your lawn is perfectly flat
customer_reviews.author: mzkita730

customer_reviews.title: Earthwise
customer_reviews.text: Its a very simple thing to use. A little tricky putting together but I got it. It really helps in my back yard when cleaning up from the burrows that fall from our trees . Really came in handy a few times especially when it is windy & lots of things fall from the trees. Saves your back a lot. And also saves you from raking & getting blisters on your hands
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Ohmacht

customer_reviews.title: One of my best yard purchases
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 honey locust trees out front; come fall and we have millions of TINY leaves. This sweeper has done an excellent job of picking them up, as well as our neighbors large leaves. Lightweight, holds enough, empties easily. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Barb D.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little indifferent on this one. It does the job it's intended to do as long as you make sure the brushes are adjusted but it definitely doesn't pick up everything. The bag is extremely poorly designed, very small and fills up extremely fast. If it gets to full closer down towards the brushes all it does is throw the leaves back on the ground under it, even if the bag isn't completely full. Again it does the job intended but its kind of a pain. I suppose if you go out every day at the very first sign of leaves falling it might work better.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Turf Sweeper!!
customer_reviews.text: This product did not disappoint!! We have turf in our backyard and two trees that constantly shed leaves. This is amazing to quickly pick up the leaves, and clean the turf-I know turf needs to be 'massaged' (I don't know another term for it) so the turf blades don't lay flat. Easy to use and maneuver. :)
customer_reviews.author: I am azon shopper

customer_reviews.title: A life (back) saver!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an electric dethatcher for our lawn and after using a traditional rake I almost called it quits and thought maybe a desert themed back yard would be better. Enter the lawn sweeper!!!! This things easily picks up 80% of the thatch and is worth every penny. I would much rather push this efficient and light weight sweeper than manually rake my lawn any day. Worth the buy if you have a larger lawn like we do.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Daitoku

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far it dose what I expected it to do. I wouldt expect this to clean 3 acres of land. But it’s light, very easy to store, and had no problem picking up leaves once adjusted properly.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: Just wasn’t worth the investment for me. As you can see from the pic, it picked up the pine needles, but that was after several passes. There needs to be a hood that covers the brushes that shoot the leaves/needles into the bag. Without it, they shoot over the bag and back into the yard. Unfortunately, the rake is still a better method. It was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, you're better off using a good old fashion broom. This just swept everything into my face. Not to mention it's flimsy as heck and just fall apart on the spot. It's like a house of cards ...one wrong move and it all tumbles apart. Definitely save your money and do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa N.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend with a sizable property devoted to animal rescue. She has plenty of volunteers, but needed a few tools to simplify the yard work. This sweeper makes keeping the yard tidy a bit easier, and can safely be used by anyone tall enough to push it. The rescue was surprised, but grateful to receive this sweeper.
customer_reviews.author: soloangel58

customer_reviews.title: Must have, lightweight, time-saving tool
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of my favorite tools this season. It is great for raking leaves, yard debris, dead grass, and lawn clippings. This tool is made of plastic and has limitations to its overall strength. It is also challenging to push through thick/tall grass, but rolls through a kept yard with ease.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: Had my Handyman assemble this product, which he claims did not have good directions. Although the product picks up most of the leaves, you still have to rake leaves. The product was easy to use in general, but hard to push, and cheaply made. The plastic parts at the bottom of the Lawn Sweeper bent easily, and the leaf catcher basket kept popping out of the plastic sleeve it fit into. It does save time raking leaves, but does not seem built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it might work on smaller leaves or grass, but I have large leaves that this would not pick up reliably. Ended up throwing this in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good Lawn Sweeper
customer_reviews.text: This is my first lawn sweeper, got it for this fall picking up leaves. I tested it picking up grass and it did ok, had to do a few passes to get 75 percent. Bag is full when it's half full, grass will spew out. Can walk fast on grass but for leaves I imagine not. Will not pick up grass on pavement. IMO this sweeper is primarily for leaf collecting. Item is light, easy to pick up. Only had it for a week, but so far I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E.

customer_reviews.title: Light duty
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made but I guess you get what you pay for! It will pick up grass if it is not heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Butler

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with my sweeper!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I had my son come over to assemble for me. He did have a little trouble, but we figured it out. I couldn't fully test it yet because the grass and leaves are wet. We just moved here in March. It looks like the previous tenants didn't rake much, so it's all compacted. That's why I got this sweeper. So far, I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: CrystalLily66

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pick up small leaves
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm sure that this product works okay, but it wasn't designed to pick up small leaves and pods. It probably works fairly well on larger leaf trees, but we have a large carob tree in our backyard that drops small leaves and large carob seed pods. I had to go over the same area on our artificial grass areas, multiple times, just to pick up about a 1/3 of the leaves on the ground and none of the pods. This tree sheds leaves and pods pretty much every day and I wanted something that I could use with a couple of passes, to pick up the leaves and pods. Unfortunately this product wasn't the right product for the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good and cleaning my yard...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this item would be a winner, so I purchased it to test it out since the price was right. It exceeded my expectations. It will pick up just about anything like leaves, thatch, pine cones, small sticks, etc. It’s construction is solid enough, so I expect it will last a few seasons. I am curious if it will put a dent in my leaf collecting time this fall. I will report back with the results.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. I wanted to love it. Nope - this thing is an absolute waste of money when using it with artificial grass. I have a mimosa tree dropping lots of leaves and spent blooms; while I normally sweep or rake, I thought this lawn sweeper would save time and allow me to have grandkids help with clean up. NOPE - pass after pass after pass and never a clear path. As a matter of fact, this thing made more of a mess by throwing the leaves out the sides. Back it went!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product has limitations
customer_reviews.text: If your yard has lots of leaves, this is worthless. It bogs down and does not work. If there is a light covering of leaves, it does pick them up. It does not hold quantity, which means many trips to the where you dump them. Because of my age (81 in 2 months) and because I am recovery from total knee surgery, it is easier to walk straight ahead and dump leaves very often, than the sideways movement of raking.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Millgard

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have artificial grass which I thought would be low maintenance. Sadly my neighbors Fir trees got in the way of those dreams. This makes it much easier to keep clean. It kicks some debri in front but a lot does get into the collector bin, and its much easier than using the rubber rake.
customer_reviews.author: Lily123

customer_reviews.title: It's amazingly no regrets I love it
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome. I have an acre of land with so many trees. The layout is a little weird and because of roots and stumps I can't take my riding lawn mower everywhere to shred the leaves and I hate raking. This thing is the perfect soultion. Its like pushing a stroller I just do a few laps a day since the leaves are still falling and dump into my fire pit. Super easy. Came quicker than expected. Easy to put together and super light. You won't regret this
customer_reviews.author: gina stone

customer_reviews.title: Returning after 5 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t work for me at all. With in 5 minutes the right front wheel started to constantly click and wobble. It would probably be ok for picking up just leaves but it didn’t even touch toss up acorns 2% of the acorns into the hopper.
customer_reviews.author: somejoe

customer_reviews.title: For the money it's a dud
customer_reviews.text: There is two problems with this leaf sweeper it's not heavy enough in the front end for the tires to keep from turning constant and the leaves that you do sweep up blow out the top of the catcher other than that it's okay I guess?
customer_reviews.author: billy ashley

customer_reviews.title: Overall, good for artificial grass. Bag system could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a good product, i used it on artificial turf. You have to dial it in for your lawn. Find the right height and speed to push for it for it to work well. It can be drastically improved by adding cardboard sides on the bag, as many leaves shoot up and over the sides of the bag (so definitely picking the leaves up). When using this on real grass for lots of leaves it works really really well.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Suited for All Grasses
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for use on St. Augustine grass. The roots are too near the surface and the leaves are caught between and under the extensive runners and tangled root system. I attempted to stop delivery when I became aware of this fact, but delivery had already been scheduled. ...was very disappointed with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Earl A. Myers, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: If used correctly this will get 80-90% oh leaves. Best part is, you don't have to bend repeatedly and this is for sure easy then racking.we get lots of leaves and this makes things easy. Twigs get trapped in brush and that is little annoying. Also wondering if having metal brushes will help more!assembly was very easy. Might not work well in very uneven ground. Will not pick up big monkey balls or big sticks. Big sticks also another picked up which is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work very well for me so... I personally do not recommend this product. It would pick things up but 25% would get thrown out of the collection bag. Seems well made for the price but was disappointed. Will be donating to the thrift store for a tax break.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Racking
customer_reviews.text: The Earthwise SweepIt worked really well picking up grass clippings and leaves from my lawn. Definitely a good buy. Remember to adjust the height if it's not picking up well and adjusting the height is very easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Phyl'licia L. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: works really well. picks up about 75% of the leaves and debris. will also pick up all the thatch mess from a dethatcher at 95% efficiency . the collection bag is big but the shape of it causes you to clean the bag more often but not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sk100

customer_reviews.title: Raking is Still Better
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea but disappointed. Tried on yard clippings - it didn’t seem all that efficient. :( Manual raking is less work and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Ayana

customer_reviews.title: Complete piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don's waste your money. This picks up nothing, you either need to go over the area a dozen times, or you could probably pick leaves up by hand and get faster results.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for weekly upkeep!
customer_reviews.text: The yard was covered in leaves before when we got the sweeper, it wasn't great for the really thick stuff, but afterwards, it has been doing a great job at helping us keep the yard leaf free for the remainder of the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Cheap junk and made of all plastic... Didn't "sweep" up much and what did sweep up blew out the sides and not into the collection bag. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Less Raking
customer_reviews.text: Even though one should use a rake to gather leaves from under shrubs and perimeter of the yard, the sweeper is so helpful in gathering the leaves without having to constantly bend over to pick them up. Yes, I had to go over the areas a few times but it cut back the time in cleaning my yard. Whatever scattered leaves remained, I raked into a small pile and was done. Once gathered, I put them into my leaf shredder and made mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Silvana

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: USUSALLY EVERYTHING I BUY IS GOOD. THIS THING IS A PIECE OF JUNK. DO NOT BUY. IT WILL NOT PICK UP ANYTHING. I REPEAT. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: RON JANOUSEK

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and pretty much worthless
customer_reviews.text: This is so lightweight and cheaply made that it won't sweep up much of anything. Compete and utter waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly the biggest piece of junk amazon sells. I'd give it zero stars if I could. The biggest problem is it just doesnt work the other problem is if you are over 3ft tall (yes, 3ft) you have to be hunched over so far your back will be sore for days after merely using this piece of junk for 10minutes while you find out said product is garbage and doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: MsbEVOgsr

customer_reviews.title: Lawn
customer_reviews.text: I got this to pick up leaves on driveway (concrete)it did not work, it works well in the grass area to pick up leaves
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in grass
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy one of these. After you get a few leaves in the basket the wheels get stuck and they turn the blades that rake the leaves in the basket so it no longer works. It works well on concrete but once in the grass it's useless. Plus no leaves ate on the concrete. If I still had the box I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Humphries

customer_reviews.title: Helps a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. We have 3 acres and tons of trees, so I won’t say we ever will get all the leaves up but this helped a lot. I am happy with what it can do because I never had the expectation that it would pick all of the leaves up. It’s easy enough to use that a couple of my kids enjoy going out and using it to help.
customer_reviews.author: LisaMarie

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good and you can’t beat the price. I have a very large oak tree that dumps leaves all day long, So I blow the leaves on to the driveway and my four year old uses the earthwise lawn sweeper to clean them up.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly ks

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: I have a decent amount of tree's on my property and racking leaves was always a pain. I don't know why I didn't buy this sooner but so glad I did. This really does make the leaf chore much more bearable and faster. If you do bag you will want to get like a bag funnel/holder as the catch bag is larger than the opening of a standard lawn bag.
customer_reviews.author: S1ngleBarrel

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to give 5 ⭐ but bag frame broke
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Makes cleaning up leaves easier. May have to go over area several times to them all. Only issue was the bars that go into bag broke and it's difficult to keep in place
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE JOB WHEN ADJUSTED RIGHT.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to sweep up sweet gun tree seed balls off the lawn. It picked up about 90 percent of them. The secret to this sweeper is to use it, adjust height as needed, use it again. Works pretty well on grass lawn but concrete drive way not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell

customer_reviews.title: Works great, takes a little time to use effectively.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great for the cost! Even my kids love sweeping the yard up! I'm really impressed with the value for what we paid! Does not pick up 100% of the grass but, probably 75-85%, so I'm very pleased! Does take a little time but we don't mind dedicating time to our lawns.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is not professional grade equipment, and no one should expect it to be for the price, but it has performed better than I expected. It assembled easily, though one of the directions is a bit confusing. It works best on dry leaves, and picks up around 90% on the first pass. It fills quickly, requiring multiple trips to the compost bin, but the leaf catcher snaps on and off easily. I bought it to use myself, but my wife has pre-empted it since she finds it fun to use. A suggested improvement would be a way to mount a garbage bag in the leaf catcher for those who bag their leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Weak, all-plastc
customer_reviews.text: Good design, but It’s relatively impractical, all plastic construction including the wheels which slip on the grass such that the ‘fingers’ do not turn freely, the product is flimsy and not really very usable.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: It picks up maple seeds (those helicopter seeds), its ok with picking up large maple leaves. and works great on weeping willow seeds. Its not perfect, and it really needs a cover to keep seeds and leaves from flying out. The other big gripe is it needs a longer handle because you're bent over pushing it, and that hurts your back. But for the price it works great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The other Reviews are True!
customer_reviews.text: It does NOT take 10-15 minutes to put together, but one person with a lot of time can put it together. I wanted the other reviews not to be true, but alas, the sweeper is not that effective. It drops more leaves than it picks up. Definitely not for perfectionists.
customer_reviews.author: No Disrespect

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Used it 3 times & it broke. Was working ok until the break. Wish it was made of metal rather than plastic. Not well made for normal usage.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Saunders

customer_reviews.title: dont bother
customer_reviews.text: Garbage and huge waste of time. I read the directions assembled it and it is just a 1/2 way working thing don't even bother my worx vacuum blower is much better product
customer_reviews.author: Mary Edwards-Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product!!! Don't waste your time and money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just not wide enough and cheaply made! For the money it's very cheaply made and I would strongly recommend that you pay a little extra and get a wider better made brand! I was very disappointed in product and workmanship!!! Do not waste your Money!!! Trust me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Fister

customer_reviews.title: I am happy I purchased this.  Racking leaves is now fun.
customer_reviews.text: Like: makes taking so Much easier. Worth every penny. dislike: leaves fall out on the sides when windy. Handle is kind of low and I am only 5’5”.
customer_reviews.author: Chun R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received the item on time as posted. Was easy to put together. However. From this point on. Disappointment. The sweeper does work as demonstrated. However the sweeping action dos not work on dirt ground, the front bar that attaches to the the back part of the sweeper head continues to fall out. Super glued the rod to stop this. Do I think is worth 70.00 Dollars? NO More like 25.00 to 30.00 Overall for lite issue with leaves and such OK Anything past that NO.
customer_reviews.author: kevin young

customer_reviews.title: This could work.
customer_reviews.text: The height adjustment needs a little longer range. The brushes need to be either a little more supple or cut in a manner to relieve tension with the grass ( I chose the latter to solve the proplem). A removable hood needs to be added to assure the leaves go in the catcher ( I did this with a piece of cardboard modified to work). Other than that the thing works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Golfer Doug

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: It get some stuff, but its design is not great and flips half the stuff back into the yard. Have turf in back I used it on and it barely got anything, it would be good but it needs a catch to prevent stuff from going into lawn, and instead in basket
customer_reviews.author: FRC

customer_reviews.title: It works. It picks up leaves. It helps save your back.
customer_reviews.text: The height setting allows picking up leaves of all sizes from tall grass or cement. It met my expectations and made it easier to bag up all the leaves. It’s not going to pick up every single piece of debris but it should do almost as well as raking.
customer_reviews.author: wtbman

customer_reviews.title: Basket isnt easily removable.
customer_reviews.text: The leaf basket does not easily detach from sweeper. So when I collect leaves and want to put in my truck, I will have to pick up the whole sweeper to dump it. Or pick up the leaves and transfer. Would have been nice if I could just remove the basket that is full of leaves and dump it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performed better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Picks up leaves, and to my surprise gum tree balls, (round spiky brown balls). After a few rounds around the yard, I had picked up most of them, however the brushes on the sweeper seem to be bent as if worned down
customer_reviews.author: Donwars

customer_reviews.title: Its Okay
customer_reviews.text: It's not the greatest invention of our lifetime, but it does okay. There are many leaves left behind after you run over them, but it picks up around 75% of them on first pass. Trying to find the right height is a little difficult. Does a lot better on pavement/concrete driveways.
customer_reviews.author: Hollarjb

product_meta.title: Earthwise LSW70021 21-Inch Leaf & Grass Push Lawn Sweeper, Width, Black
product_meta.description: Don't waste your time and energy by useing a rake to clear away leaves, grass clippings, debris, even pine cones. With a lawn sweeper, the job becomes much easier on you and your lawn. Clean your lawn with Earthwise large 21" lawn sweeper. The large 21-inch sweeping width two brushes per section is great for tackleing grass clippings, leaves, and debris with ease. Quickly tailor the sweeper to suit the terrain with adjustable height control – ideal for transitioning from lawns to patios, sidewalks and driveways. Tirering/Back-breaking lawn cleanups are a thing of the past; set the rake aside this year and go with Earthwise Sweep it! ATTENTION: Make sure the height of the brushes are adjusted to your lawn for optimum sweeping performance.
feature_bullets: Leaf and grass clipping sweeper: great tool for collecting leaves and grass clippings around the yard; 21" Brush width
Spinning rake-like Action: sweeps leaves and grass clippings off lawn surface and into collection bag; ideal for Small clean-up jobs
Easy to use, light & sturdy: body made of lightweight, high strength materials for easy maneuvering; handle made of Steel with scratch resistant, powder-coated finish
Height adjustable: simply raise brushes higher If pushing Becomes difficult; lower brushes if not collecting debris
Great way to quickly rake leaves & grass: does not pick up rocks, nuts, pinecones, or wet debris; 80% pick-up on first pass

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars989 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
